title: Snakes slither, roads flood: What Mumbai rains did to city - 10 videos that show havoc
content: Maharashtra is grappling with severe flooding due to incessant rains, claiming at least six lives and displacing hundreds. Mumbai and other districts are on high alert as the IMD forecasts more intense rainfall. Authorities are evacuating vulnerable areas, with the NDRF and Army assisting in rescue operations. Farmland is submerged, and infrastructure is severely damaged, disrupting connectivity across the state.

title: Russia sets major rider for 'long-term peace' deal, day after Zelenskyy-Trump meet
content: Russia stated firmly that any lasting peace agreement with Ukraine must address the security concerns of Russia and the rights of Russian-speaking people in Ukraine. This declaration followed discussions between Zelenskyy and Trump, where Trump indicated he would consult with Putin after their meeting.

title: 'India will be ...': What BJP said on impact of Trump's tariff; cites local consumption
content: The BJP downplayed the impact of US tariffs on India, emphasizing the nation's strong domestic consumption, contributing significantly to its GDP. Syed Zafar Islam highlighted India's resilience amidst global economic challenges, contrasting it with higher inflation rates in the US and UK. He credited PM Modi's policies for strengthening India's economy, citing positive outlooks from international rating agencies.

title: 'Ghuspaithiya Bachao Yatra': BJP targets Rahul's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' after Psephologist's apology
content: BJP has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi for his "vote theft" allegations, following Sanjay Kumar's admission of incorrect voter data related to Maharashtra elections. BJP accuses Gandhi of using false figures to push a narrative against the Election Commission. Malviya demands an apology from Rahul, calling his yatra a scheme to protect infiltrators after Kumar apologized for the misleading claims.

title: Asia Cup 2025: 5 shocking omissions from India‚Äôs squad - Shreyas Iyer, Yashasvi Jaiswal miss out
content: Suryakumar Yadav and Ajit Agarkar revealed the Asia Cup squad. Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal were surprisingly left out. Washington Sundar and Mohammed Siraj also missed the cut. The squad includes Suryakumar Yadav as captain and Shubman Gill as vice-captain. The Asia Cup will be held in Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

title: AI & geopolitics: OpenAI CEO ‚Äòworried about China‚Äô; Warns US, flags new ‚ÄòChina-Safe‚Äô chips policy
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns that the U.S. is underestimating China's AI advancements and that export controls alone won't solve the geopolitical AI race. He expresses skepticism about the effectiveness of current policies, suggesting China may find workarounds or develop domestic alternatives. Altman highlights the complexity of the U.S.‚ÄìChina AI competition, noting it extends beyond a simple comparison of capabilities.

title: Vote Adhikar Yatra: Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs convoy 'crushes' cop - watch
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi after a video surfaced allegedly showing his car running over a police constable during the 'Vote Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla shared the video, claiming the officer was critically injured and Gandhi did not stop to check on him.

title: Apple's big India move: All iPhone 17 models Made in India for US; Trump could be reason why
content: Apple is set to manufacture all iPhone 17 models in India before their September launch, a first for the company, including the Pro versions. This shift, driven by tariff concerns and geopolitical tensions, aims to fulfill most US iPhone demand from India. Tata Group will produce half of India's iPhones, boosting exports which reached $7.

title: Asia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neck
content: Shubman Gill's elevation to India's T20I vice-captain is a clear sign that he might end up leading the team instead of Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I World Cup at home. There are still seven months to go to the marquee event, and in Indian cricket, things can change in seven hours.

title: Airline-style baggage charges in trains? Railways to implement new strict luggage rules
content: Indian Railways is implementing stricter baggage rules, including weight checks at major stations like Prayagraj Junction, mirroring airline practices. Passengers exceeding weight limits will face extra charges, with allowances varying by travel class.

title: 'Will make Rahul PM': Tejashwi Yadav vows 2029 support; calls NDA govt in Bihar 'khatara'
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav appealed to Bihar voters. He wants them to support Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for Prime Minister in 2029. Yadav aims to defeat the National Democratic Alliance in the upcoming state elections. He criticized Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's government. Yadav accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of voter disenfranchisement.

title: ‚ÄòRockets to Wall Street‚Äô: Musk‚Äôs teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: No thanks: How Zelenskyy snubbed Trump by not suiting up
content: But Zelenskyy has spent the last three years rewriting that script. His wartime wardrobe is not an accident of comfort but a deliberate symbol. Sweatshirts, fatigues, and henleys have become part of Ukraine‚Äôs frontline diplomacy, reminding the world at every summit that Kyiv is not hosting cocktail parties but fighting for survival.

title: Asia Cup 2025: India selectors continue to be unfair on Shreyas Iyer; one squad sheet at a time!
content: Indian cricket must keep the door open for Shreyas Iyer in white-ball formats, especially with the T20 World Cup at home next year. Though his inclusion at No. 3 adds more right-handers than Gautam Gambhir might prefer, Iyer‚Äôs ability to anchor innings and adapt makes him indispensable. His presence balances flair with stability, making him a strong contender for a starting spot.

title: 'We finally feel accepted‚Äô: Gujarat village ends Dalit haircut ban
content: In a village in Banaskantha, a Dalit man received a haircut at a local barber shop for the first time, marking the end of a decades-long discriminatory practice. This change came after persistent efforts from the Dalit community, local activists, and intervention from the district administration.

title: Stuart Skinner‚Äôs wife Chloe shares holiday photos; son Beau holds snake‚Äîsee pics
content: Edmonton Oilers goalie Stuart Skinner balanced family time and professional dedication this offseason. His wife, Chloe, shared vacation photos, including one of their son Beau posing with a snake. Despite recent Stanley Cup Final losses, Skinner is determined to improve and lead the Oilers, alongside stars Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl, in their quest to end a long championship drought.

title: ‚ÄòWe are alive‚Äô: Elderly MP couple kneel before minister as records show them ‚Äòdead‚Äô
content: An elderly couple in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district, declared 'dead' in panchayat records, pleaded with a state minister for justice after their land was allegedly seized. The district collector has ordered an inquiry, revealing the couple had migrated decades ago and their land was sold by their son, who is now deceased.

title: Tower Ride' collapses from height of 50 feet in Gujarat
content: A major accident at a fair in Bilimora, Navsari, injured five people, including two children, when a 'Tower Ride' collapsed from 50 feet. The incident occurred amidst large crowds gathered near Somnath Temple. Police are investigating possible negligence, while a committee probes procedural lapses. The accident has raised concerns about public safety at Gujarat fairs, reminiscent of past tragedies.

title: Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs sister alleges Sachdev forced mother to sign papers amid feud
content: Following Sunjay Kapur's death, a family feud has erupted over his substantial estate. His sister, Mandhira, alleges that their mother was coerced into signing documents by Sunjay's widow, Priya Sachdev, and others during the mourning period.

title: Psephologist deletes 'voters dip in Maharashtra' post; draws BJP's ire
content: Sanjay Kumar from Lokniti-CSDS apologised for a post about Maharashtra election data. The post incorrectly showed a voter decrease in two constituencies. BJP criticised Kumar, alleging bias. The apology occurred amid tensions between the India bloc and the Election Commission of India. Rahul Gandhi accused the ECI of vote theft.

title: Maharashtra rain havoc continues: Toll rises to 8, hundreds evacuated
content: Heavy rainfall continues to batter Maharashtra, resulting in eight deaths in the past two days, including a 75-year-old woman killed in a Raigad landslide. With Mumbai and other districts on high alert, authorities are evacuating residents and deploying rescue teams. The IMD forecasts continued intense rainfall, while agricultural land and villages face inundation.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Who will open the batting? Ajit Agarkar clears the air
content: Suryakumar Yadav leads India in the Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill as his deputy. The squad announcement sparked debate, especially regarding the opening combination of Abhishek Sharma with either Gill or Sanju Samson. India aims to balance power and stability in their top order as they face Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in Group A, beginning September 10 in Dubai.

title: 'Vote chori' row: Posters urge Anna Hazare to ‚Äòwake up‚Äô; activist calls incident ‚Äòunfortunate‚Äô
content: Posters have surfaced in Pune, urging Anna Hazare to address alleged 'vote theft,' prompting the veteran activist to express sadness over being questioned. Hazare emphasized his past contributions in enacting anti-corruption laws and encouraged the younger generation to take the lead.

title: ‚ÄòThe dead don‚Äôt talk‚Äô: Fingerprints cracked Sohna mystery; revenge plot trail exposed
content: Gurgaon police solved a perplexing murder case in Sohna, where a man was found dead with his throat slit. The victim was identified as Sameer, an accused in a Pocso case from Rishikesh, through fingerprint analysis and a tattoo. Investigations revealed that Sameer was murdered by the girl's brother, Sonu, and his accomplices as revenge for eloping with his sister.

title: Lok Sabha goes multilingual: Interpretation available in all 22 scheduled languages
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced the availability of simultaneous interpretation in all 22 languages listed in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution, completing the list with the addition of Kashmiri, Konkani, and Santhali. This advancement ensures smoother communication, reflecting India's linguistic diversity in parliamentary proceedings. BJP MP Dr.

title: Doval meets China's Wang Yi: NSA praises 'upward trend' on India-China ties
content: NSA Ajit Doval met with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, highlighting the positive impact of the Modi-Xi meeting in Kazan on bilateral relations. Doval noted improved border conditions and increased engagement. Jaishankar emphasized the importance of maintaining peace at the border and preventing differences from escalating into disputes during his meeting with Wang Yi.

title: 'Tomorrow not promised': SUV crashes into YouTubers mid-meal ‚Äì watch
content: YouTubers NinaUnrated and Patrick Blackwood experienced a terrifying incident while filming a food review at Piada Italian Street Food in Tyler, Texas. An SUV crashed through the restaurant's glass wall, hitting the pair and causing minor injuries. Blackwood, who was sitting next to the window, sustained cuts from the shattered glass, but both reviewers expressed gratitude for surviving the unexpected event.

title: CEO axes 80% staff: How AI literacy could make or break your career
content: IgniteTech CEO Eric Vaughan laid off 80% of staff after resistance to AI adoption, underscoring the urgent need for AI literacy in today‚Äôs workforce. For professionals, AI fluency drives career growth and adaptability, while for students, it builds confidence and future readiness. Embracing AI as a collaborator, with ethics in mind, is now essential for career survival.

title: Mumbai's rain misery: 300mm downpour paralyses city; Mithi river swells
content: Mumbai grappled with torrential rains, prompting authorities to declare a holiday for schools, colleges, and government offices. Municipal Commissioner Bhushan Gagrani reported over 300 mm of rainfall in many areas, leading to the evacuation of 400 residents from low-lying Krantinagar.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla shares with PM Modi how 'India‚Äôs secrets' helped him in space
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently met Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla. Shukla shared his experiences from the NASA Axiom-4 mission. He highlighted global enthusiasm for India's Gaganyaan mission. Discussions included the challenges of space travel and experiments with food. Modi emphasized the need for more Indian astronauts. Shukla stressed the importance of government support for space research.

title: 'Progressive jurist': INDIA bloc finalises VP nominee; picks ex-SC judge B Sudershan Reddy
content: Mallikarjun Kharge announced that former Supreme Court judge B Sudershan Reddy is the INDIA bloc's candidate for the Vice Presidential elections on September 9. Kharge praised Reddy as a distinguished jurist and champion of social justice, highlighting his pro-poor judgments and commitment to the Constitution. Reddy will file his nomination on August 21, with opposition parties uniting in support.

title: Hate crime in UK: Teenagers attack Sikh men, remove their turbans - video
content: A disturbing video from the UK shows three teenagers assaulting two Sikh men outside a Wolverhampton railway station on August 15, sparking outrage. The victims were kicked while on the ground, and their turbans were forcibly removed. Authorities have arrested the teenagers, who were later released on bail, prompting calls for a thorough investigation and justice for the victims.

title: 'Partitioned country twice': PM slams Nehru for Indus Treaty; calls him 'anti-farmer' at NDA meet
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi again criticised Jawaharlal Nehru for the Indus Water Treaty, claiming it favored Pakistan and harmed Indian farmers. He stated Nehru himself admitted the treaty's lack of benefit. Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi countered, accusing Modi of evading responsibility by blaming past leaders after being in power for 11 years.

title: New beginning! Prithvi Shaw silences critics with stunning ton on debut - Watch
content: Prithvi Shaw marked his Maharashtra debut with a brilliant century against Chhattisgarh in the Buchi Babu Tournament 2025, held in Chennai. After facing form and fitness challenges, the right-hander's innings helped Maharashtra recover from an early collapse, showcasing his resilience. Shaw's move to Maharashtra aims to revitalise his career after a difficult period with Mumbai, seeking new opportunities for growth.

title: Trump‚Äôs 50% tariffs loom: Govt plans measures to shield export sectors- Details
content: The government is considering targeted support for exporters facing US tariffs. Instead of a broad loan guarantee, sector-specific credit lines with relaxed collateral are being explored. Initiatives include linking lending with PM Vishwakarma and BharatNet.

title: ‚ÄòWar 2‚Äô box office, day 6: Hrithik, Jr NTR starrer starts on slow note; earlier crossed Rs180 cr
content: Released on August 14, 'War 2' clashed with 'Coolie' at the box office during a long weekend. Despite a decent start, 'War 2' lagged behind 'Coolie' on the first day, earning ‚Çπ51.5 crore compared to ‚Çπ65 crore. However, collections significantly dropped by Monday. The Hindi version underperformed, and overall, the film's ‚Çπ184.

title: No Category A! Babar Azam suffers major setback, demoted in PCB central contracts
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board's latest central contracts for 2025-26 have stirred controversy by demoting Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan to Category B, while no player was placed in Category A. Salman Ali Agha, Saim Ayub, and Haris Rauf have been promoted, and the pool of contracted players has expanded to 30, including 12 new names.

title: Is Israel planning to move Palestinians to South Sudan? Netanyahu hints at migration
content: Israel is reportedly considering transferring Palestinians from Gaza to South Sudan as part of a larger initiative promoting emigration. While Israeli officials frame this as 'voluntary migration,' questions remain about the possibility of return. South Sudan has publicly denied involvement, though private discussions with Israeli representatives have occurred, according to sources.

title: Musk's warning on US birth rate decline: ‚ÄòThe population is collapsing‚Ä¶,‚Äô Tim Pool highlights risks
content: Concerns are mounting over declining global birth rates, as highlighted by Tim Pool and Elon Musk. Musk warns that the population collapse is already happening, with a "tsunami" of economic and societal impacts imminent. Falling fertility rates, particularly in the US, threaten workforce sustainability, economic growth, and social systems, posing significant challenges for countries worldwide.

title: Who is B Sudershan Reddy? INDIA bloc's nominee for VP polls
content: The Congress has nominated B Sudershan Reddy as their candidate for the upcoming Vice Presidential elections, as announced by Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge. Reddy, born in 1946 and an advocate since 1971, previously served as a Government Pleader in the Andhra Pradesh High Court. This decision follows discussions among opposition leaders and comes after the NDA nominated CP Radhakrishnan.

title: Putin, security guarantees and a hot mic: Zelenskyy's suit diplomacy woos Trump
content: President Trump's recent meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders signals a potential path to peace talks with Russia, a stark contrast to their previous strained encounter. Discussions revolved around European-led security guarantees for Ukraine, with Trump hinting at US support. Arrangements are underway for a Zelenskyy-Putin meeting, though disagreements persist over ceasefire terms and territorial compromises.

title: Hendrickson not budging in standoff with Bengals
content: Bengals defensive end Trey Hendrickson remains entrenched in his position on not playing in the upcoming season.

title: Commanders' Robinson sits out amid uncertainty
content: Washington Commanders veteran running back Brian Robinson Jr. did not play in his club's 31-17 preseason loss to the Cincinnati Bengals on Monday night in Landover, Maryland, possibly signaling the end of his tenure with the franchise after three seasons.

title: Titans QB Ward scuffles with DT Simmons in camp
content: Titans rookie QB Cam Ward got into a scuffle with defensive lineman Jeffrey Simmons as the two exchanged shoves.

title: D-backs star Marte apologizes, explains absence
content: Ketel Marte explained he was "frustrated" and "in a bad spot" after his home was burglarized during the All-Star break, leading him to miss games.

title: Vlad Jr. hurts hammy doing splits at 1B; MRI next
content: Toronto Blue Jays first baseman Vladimir Guerrero Jr. left Monday night's 5-2 loss to Pittsburgh because of hamstring tightness.

title: Padres' Bogaerts loses HR on fan interference call
content: San Diego's Xander Bogaerts had a home run overturned due to fan interference, and Padres manager Mike Shildt was ejected for coming out of the dugout to talk to the umpires in the second inning of Monday night's 4-3 loss to the San Francisco Giants.

title: Texas Tech's Joyner, USC transfer, out for season
content: Texas Tech running back Quinten Joyner, a projected starter who transferred from USC, will sit out the 2025 season after he sustained a non-contact knee injury in Saturday's scrimmage.

title: UFC HOFer Edgar unretiring for Bare Knuckle fight
content: UFC Hall of Famer Frankie Edgar is poised to come out of retirement for a bare-knuckle boxing contest.

content: Peak draft season is almost here. Our crew provides a good practice run through a 12-teamer to help you prepare for the real thing.

title: Cam Ward, Brian Callahan and the Tennessee Titans' historically worrying challenge
content: The past two No. 1 picks have seen their coaches fired in November. How will Cam Ward (and Brian Callahan) avoid the same fate?

content: Here's what separates the Cy Young favorites from other aces, according to those who watch them most.

title: 'Building stuff is fun, man': How Diego Pavia helped Vanderbilt rise from its ruins
content: Never one to back down, Vandy's brash QB has made a name for himself in Nashville -- and he's not done yet.

title: A quest to understand the Carlos Alcaraz/Emma Raducanu ship
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu say they're just friends. But a growing group of their fans is rooting for far more than just a US Open mixed doubles title. Welcome to the world of tennis shippers.

title: NBA milestones: Landmarks to watch this season for LeBron, Jokic and others
content: Important milestones to watch ahead of the 2025-26 season, including another historic season from LeBron James and Nikola Jokic.

title: 'You felt the momentum change': Michael Vick's early impact at Norfolk State
content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

title: What Browns naming Joe Flacco QB1 means for Shedeur Sanders, Dillon Gabriel
content: The questions surrounding the Browns' Week 1 starter are answered, but the clock to begin finding the long-term solution continues to run.

title: Answering the biggest questions facing Keegan Bradley with six U.S. Ryder Cup spots left
content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

title: How will Xabi Alonso handle LaLiga refereeing at Real Madrid?
content: As Real Madrid's new manager, Xabi Alonso will soon be exposed to the eccentricities of LaLiga refereeing. One thing's for certain: Alonso won't be afraid to speak out when he feels it is necessary.

content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

content: After visits with 10 NFL teams in eight states, Ben Solak compiled the best things he heard -- and saw -- throughout the trip.

title: What early issues need solving for some top Premier League clubs?
content: The first matchday of the Premier League is over, so what did some of the top clubs learn from it? Arsenal need to fix their press, while Chelsea could play Cole Palmer out wide.

content: Manchester United could look to Antwerp goalkeeper Senne Lammens as Inter Milan consider a reunion with Andr√© Onana. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Messi's return helps Miami's surge
content: Lionel Messi's return is a huge boost for Inter Miami as they look to take the top spot in the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

title: Moses Itauma makes massive impression at heavyweight
content: Itauma's quick finish of Dillian Whyte on Saturday elevates him in top 10. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Venus Williams is back at the US Open -- eyeing one title not on her long list
content: Two-time former US Open champion Venus Williams will play again this week. And she still has one major career goal.

title: Karnataka rains: Torrential rainfall hits normal life in Yadgir district
content: Hundreds of acres of agricultural fields were inundated by rainwater, posing a threat of damage to cotton and green gram crops.

title: ISRO working on 40-storey-tall rocket to place 75-tonne payload in space: Narayanan
content: Explaining the domestic space journey, V. Narayanan said today India is in a position to rub shoulders with advanced space-faring nations

title: Parliament passes Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill
content: The Bill, which seeks to amend the original Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957, was passed in Lok Sabha on August 12

title: Justice B. Sudershan Reddy: from the Bench to Vice-Presidential nominee
content: The INDIA bloc has selected Justice B.‚ÄØSudershan Reddy, a former Supreme Court judge, as its joint candidate for the Vice‚ÄëPresidential election scheduled for September 9, 2025.

title: Lifestyle interventions crucial to improving mental health: Lancet report
content: Report recommends that physical interventions to improve the four modifiable pillars of lifestyle ‚Äì physical activity, nutrition, smoking cessation and sleep ‚Äì are key to improving mental health as well as physical health.

title: Madras High Court stays civil proceedings questioning Edappadi Palaniswami‚Äôs authority to lead AIADMK
content: Justice P.B. Balaji grants the interim stay following a revision petition filed against a city civil court‚Äôs July 31, 2025 order

title: Revenue Minister Satya Prasad urges people to be vigilant as water level rises in Krishna
content: Authorities have been instructed to keep residents alert and, if necessary, evacuate those in low-lying areas to designated relief camps

title: India essential part of solution for world‚Äôs main challenges, including cross-border terrorism: Murmu
content: Addressing a group of officer trainees of the Indian Foreign Service (2024 batch), the President asked them to bear in mind "Rashtrahit Sarvopari" (nation first) while embracing the spirit of "Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam" (world is a family)

title: SIT gets custody of youth accused of abetting woman‚Äôs suicide
content: The police team took Rameez to various locations, including places where he met the victim when they were allegedly in a relationship, for evidence collection.

title: Gujarat High Court extends Asaram's interim bail till September 3
content: On July 30, the Supreme Court granted Asaram the liberty to approach the Gujarat HC for temporary bail extension mainly on the ground of his deteriorating health condition

title: SC dismisses NCPCR challenge to HC order upholding validity of minor Muslim girl‚Äôs marriage under personal law
content: A Bench headed by Justice B.V. Nagarathna observed that the rights body lacked locus standi and cautioned against the criminalisation of consensual adolescent relationships

title: Union Cabinet approves six-lane Bhubaneswar Bypass project for ‚Çπ8,307.74 crore
content: The upgraded corridor will enhance multi-modal integration by connecting with a major railway station, an airport, a proposed multi-modal logistics park (MMLP), and two major ports

content: Officials collected samples of some food items and packaged items which would be sent to laboratory for examination, says the FSSAI officials

title: Ramadoss chairs PMK‚Äôs Disciplinary Action Committee, to send show-cause notice to Anbumani
content: Mr. Anbumani should submit his explanation over the charges against him either in person or through letter to Thailapuram by August 31, said Salem West MLA and committee member R. Arul

title: Cabinet approves airport project at Kota-Bundi in Rajasthan for ‚Çπ1,507 crore
content: Once operational, the new airport at Kota-bundi in Rajasthan will have the capacity to handle 2 million passengers per year

content: The Vice-Presidential election, set for September 9, 2025, will see NDA‚Äôs C. P. Radhakrishnan face INDIA bloc nominee Justice B. Sudershan Reddy. Who votes, how is the process conducted, and where do the numbers stand?

title: T.N. gives green light to Chennai Metro Rail for preparatory work on Koyambedu-Avadi-Pattabiram project
content: This means that Chennai Metro Rail can take up work pertaining to land acquisition, the shifting of utilities, and other aspects

title: Surplus water released from Erode‚Äôs Bhavanisagar Dam
content: Water level at the dam in Erode district touches 102 feet against its full reservoir level of 105 feet

title: Rahul Gandhi alleges partnership between ECI and BJP
content: Explaining the impact of the alleged vote theft, the Congress leader pointed out that first, voter cards will be taken away, then ration cards and lands will be ‚Äúgiven to Adani and Ambani‚Äù

title: Madras High Court judges to visit Coimbatore forests where steel wire fences are proposed for human-elephant conflict prevention
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy decide to inspect the areas in Coimbatore district along with amici curiae and Special Government Pleader on September 5 and 6

title: Kalaburagi bench of Karnataka High Court orders regularisation of gangwoman‚Äôs service after 26 years
content: Legal experts said the judgment would serve as an important precedent for contract and daily-wage workers awaiting regularisation in various departments

title: BJP using Nitish till Bihar polls, wants to form government through backdoor, says Kanhaiya Kumar
content: The Congress leader alleged that when the issue of rigging is being raised before the ECI, it is talking about irrelevant things

content: After offering prayers, the officers of Karnataka Power Corporation Limited (KPCL), who manage the reservoir and dam, began opening the gates around 10 a.m.

title: Reality show winner in Kerala booked in theft case
content: According to police, the complainant alleged that Jinto trespassed on the gym, which she had taken on lease from him, and stole money and some documents

content: The bench orally remarked that the government‚Äôs decision of giving an ‚Äòextraordinary‚Äô chunk of land to Mahabal Cement Private Limited is the opposite of its objective, that is public interest

title: Kerala headmaster arrested on charges of assaulting student, causing  eardrum rupture
content: The incident took place on August 11 at school assembly where the headmaster allegedly noticed the Class 10 student playing with pebbles, called him to the front of and slapped him

title: Rahul Gandhi will become PM after next Lok Sabha polls: RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi at Bihar rally
content: Addressing a rally on the third day of Congress' 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Nawada, Mr. Yadav also said the time has come for the young generation to get a chance to run the State

title: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik‚Äôs health condition significantly improved, says hospital
content: The former Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik, is fully stable, talking to doctors, and doing well, hospital authorities said

title: Rate rationalisation in GST welcome, but States‚Äô revenues should be protected, says Karnataka Revenue Minister Byre Gowda
content: Speaking to The Hindu, Mr. Byre Gowda, who is also a member of the Group of Ministers on rate rationalisation,  said that the impact of the Centre‚Äôs proposals have to be carefully assessed

title: Civet problem forces Kerala High Court to adjourn for the day
content: Hearings before a Bench led by the Chief Justice were adjourned after urgent matters to allow cleaning of ceiling and air conditioner duct of courtroom reportedly dirtied by palm civets

content: Extending the party‚Äôs best wishes, Mr. Lokesh lauded Mr. Radhakrishnan‚Äôs distinguished career in public service, highlighting his administrative experience as Governor of multiple states.¬†

content: The decision was taken unanimously, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said in a press conference, flanked by leaders of INDIA bloc

title: In meeting with Wang Yi, Doval talks about ‚Äònew momentum‚Äô in Sino-Indian ties, peace at border
content: There has been peace and tranquillity along the border, Mr. Doval said, adding ‚Äúthe bilateral engagements between the two countries have been more substantial‚Äù now; he also said Mr. Modi will attend the upcoming SCO summit in China

title: India, China ties showing positive trend, says Chinese FM Wang Yi
content: Wang Yi says that this year marks the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and India, and lessons could be learned from the past

title: Road accident in Punjab leaves three dead
content: Police identified the deceased as Ishwar Lal, Mukesh and driver Rakesh, all residents of Bihar, currently residing in Kapurthala.

title: 'Strange people' visiting Assam, will be arrested if they 'cross limits': CM
content: ‚ÄúWe will not tolerate any fundamentalist activities or politics on sensitive issues, whether they come from Kerala, Mumbai or Delhi‚Äù

title: Madras High Court judge to watch Vetri Maaran‚Äôs Manushi to decide on CBFC‚Äôs suggestion for 37 cuts
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh decides to watch the Gopi Nainar directorial during a private screening on August 24 to find out if the Central Board of Film Certification is justified in suggesting 37 cuts

title: Two killed as bus from Sangli to Tamil Nadu overturns in Haveri district of Karnataka
content: According to the police, the driver lost control while trying avoid hitting a car, which suddenly came in front of the bus. The bus hit the road divider and overturned

title: Journalists‚Äô bodies condemn sedition charges against Siddharth Varadarajan, Karan Thapar of The Wire
content: The bodies alleged that the Assam Police unleashed vindictive actions against the journalists through the Crime Branch

title: Amoeba found in well water at house of girl who died due to amoebic encephalitis in Kerala
content: Following detection of amoeba, fever survey has been carried out among all those who used the water from the well

title: Karnataka rains: Eight bridges submerged as water levels rise in Krishna and Malaprabha rivers, warning issued
content: Maharashtra irrigation officials informed their counterparts in Karnataka that outflow from the Koyna dam on the Krishna river was being increased

title: Biodiversity of Thattekad Bird Sanctuary in Kerala grows richer as survey reveals nine more species
content: Findings of three-day faunal survey, which adopted a multi-taxa approach, at Kerala‚Äôs first bird sanctuary reaffirms its position as one of the richest ecological zones in Western Ghats

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: Death toll climbs to 64 after woman‚Äôs body recovered
content: The decomposed body was sighted downstream and subsequently recovered by the rescuers amid intensified search operation with the improvement in the weather, the officials said

title: In a first, American Hindu Coalition endorses Pakistani American candidate in Virginia race
content: The election is scheduled for November 4, and while Mr. Khan acknowledges the uphill battle of contesting in a largely blue district, he believes that support from Indian and Hindu American voters could provide a decisive edge.

title: Soldier assaulted at U.P. toll plaza, Army condemns; six held, NHAI slaps ‚Çπ20 lakh fine on operator
content: When Kapil‚Äôs car was caught in a long queue en route to the Delhi airport, he asked the toll staff to clear the way faster, leading to an altercation

title: Lot of interest about Gaganyaan world over: Shubhanshu Shukla tells PM Modi
content: PM Modi said there was a need to have a pool of 40-50 astronauts ready for India‚Äôs future space missions

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 19 highlights: Rajya Sabha passes Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill; Lok Sabha passes bill to set up IIM in Guwahati
content: Opposition MPs have submitted notices in both Houses to discuss Bihar SIR; Rajya Sabha passed the Indian Ports Bill, 2025 on Monday (August 18, 2025)

title: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar embarks on 3-day visit to Russia
content: S Jaishankar will co-chair the 26th Session of the India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Trade, Economic, Scientific, Technological and Cultural Cooperation to be held on Wednesday, August 20

title: Tamil Nadu, Kerala ask Supreme Court if Presidential Reference is a ploy to contradict itself
content: Kerala and Tamil Nadu have criticised the Presidential Reference for ‚Äúsuppressing‚Äù the very existence of the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment of April 8

title: Supreme Court hearing on Presidential Reference updates: President and Governors are representations of democratic will, says SG
content: A Constitution Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai is hearing on the Reference with Kerala and Tamil Nadu getting an hour to convince the Court to return the Reference unanswered

title: Ganga level in Haridwar crosses warning level, rescue personnel on alert
content: The water level, already 10 cm above the warning level on August 18, 2025, was rising, prompting the administration to ask people near the floodplains to remain alert

title: Yamuna water level rises close to evacuation mark in Delhi
content: Officials said the situation is being closely monitored and all the agencies concerned have been asked to take precautionary measures to handle flood-like situation

title: Two youths electrocuted while transporting Ganesh idol in Hyderabad
content: The incident reportedly happened when the idol brushed against overhead power lines, sending a surge of current through the group

title: Who decides nominations to UT Assemblies? | Explained
content: How should members be recommended to the Jammu & Kashmir Legislative Assembly? What does the Government of Union Territories Act, 1963 state with respect to nominations to the Puducherry Assembly? What was the ‚Äòtriple chain of command‚Äô opined by the Supreme Court in 2023?

title: Mumbai rains¬†LIVE: Eight killed in Nanded flooding, record 300 mm downpour in Mumbai
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis reviewed the flood situation with the disaster management department, said the next 48 hours would be crucial for Mumbai, Thane, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg Districts

title: Parai music resounds across Chennai‚Äôs neighbourhoods
content: As more people step up to learn this art form, finding a place to practise isn‚Äôt easy; the parai collectives tell members to focus on career and education, and pursue parai as an art form

title: Tea sector in the Peerumade hills grappling with fresh challenges
content: The active number of tea estates in the Peerumade hills was 40, and the number has now dropped to 28, data shows

title: Young anacondas use surprising S-shaped gait to make quick escapes
content: Researchers from IIT-Bombay and Harvard University have said that by providing precise mathematical measures to reproduce such motion in artificial systems, their study can help accelerate innovation in soft robotics. One example: snake-like robots that can navigate through very narrow or confined spaces

title: Headmaster accused of assaulting student in Kasaragod; Minister orders inquiry
content: Headmaster denies allegation, saying that he had only reprimanded the boy for misbehaving during the assembly. Youth Congress demands suspension of HM

title: Govt. finding it tough to fill V-C posts
content: State-run universities are finding it difficult to fill up the Vice-Chancellor‚Äôs post owing to applications from ineligible persons, Higher Education Minister M.C. Sudhakar

title: Internal quota: Options being worked out to bring about consensus
content: Monday evening saw hectic parleys among Ministers and officials belonging to Scheduled Castes to arrive at a consensus on the internal reservation on the eve of the special Cabinet meeting, even as the Dalit left (Madigas) and the Dalit right (Holeyas) continued to exert pressure on the government

title: Same-sex couples demand recognition as ‚Äòspouses‚Äô in the IT Act to receive tax benefits
content: The petitioners argued that they should not be denied benefits under the law solely because their partnership is not heterosexual

title: Karnataka Assembly plunges into pandemonium over Dharmasthala row
content: The Legislative Assembly plunged into pandemonium on Monday over the case of alleged mass burials in Dharmasthala, with the ruling and the Opposition members indulging in heated exchange of words

title: Activists, Opposition parties seek probe into West Bengal‚Äôs Deocha-Pachami coal project
content: They alleged financial irregularities, violation of tender agreement, and massive damage to the environment and local communities in connection with the project in Birbhum district

title: Back-to-back arrest of MSC vessels poses challenge to Vizhinjam port
content: The arrest of MSC vessels specifically at the Vizhinjam port sends a wrong signal to the world regarding the port, say port sources. This comes at a time when the port is already witnessing a decline in container discharge.

title: CPI urges government to form expert committee to release Tamil Nadu Labour Policy
content: The party‚Äôs 26th State Conference concludes. One of the key resolutions passed during the conference criticises the Centre for consolidating 44 labour welfare laws into four labour codes, against which workers across the country have been protesting

content: CPI(M) State secretary P. Shanmugam challenges Mr. Thirumavalavan‚Äôs position and urged him to clarify his stance

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Man Poisons Wife, Buries Her Body In Graveyard In Delhi, Arrested: Cops
content: A man, along with his three associates, killed his wife by administering sleeping pills laced with poison over suspicion of infidelity and buried the body in a graveyard in South Delhi, police said on Tuesday.

title: Bill To Regulate Online Gaming Gets Cabinet Nod, Next Stop Lok Sabha
content: A bill to regulate online gaming has been cleared by the union cabinet, and is likely to be introduced in the Lok Sabha tomorrow, sources said.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants End Strike After Reaching 'Tentative' Deal
content: The union representing Air Canada flight attendants said on Tuesday it had ended a strike over wages and unpaid ground work after reaching a "tentative agreement" with the airline.

title: 'Finding 70 Missing In Kishtwar Cloudburst Alive Next To Impossible': Omar Abdullah
content: Five days after a cloudburst hit the Machail Mata yatra base camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, killing at least 64 people, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has said finding the 70 missing people alive is next to impossible.

title: BJP Targets Congress's 'Vote Chori' Campaign After Psephologist's Apology
content: Two days after he flagged significant voter additions and deletions in the Maharashtra Assembly election, psephologist Sanjay Kumar of the Centre for the Study of Developing Societies (CSDS) has apologised and deleted the posts

title: "Submarine Service Launched In Mumbai": Memes Take Over Amid Rain, Flooding
content: Heavy rains submerged parts of Mumbai on Tuesday morning, and it wasn't just the financial capital's streets that were flooded. It rained memes on social media as well, with people saying they had grown accustomed to the city's downpour.

title: "No Ambiguity": BJP Ally Bites Bullet After INDIA's Andhra Pick For Veep
content: Hours after the INDIA Opposition bloc announced former Supreme Court judge B Sudershan Reddy as its candidate for the Vice Presidential election, key BJP ally TDP said there is "no ambiguity" regarding its choice

title: India Needs 40-50 Astronauts For Upcoming Space Missions: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India needs to build a pool of 40-50 astronauts ready to lead future space missions as he interacted with Shubhanshu Shukla, who is back after spending 20 days in space.

title: Civil Judge Aspirant Who Disappeared During Train Journey Finally Traced
content: A civil judge aspirant whose mysterious disappearance had gripped the entire state of Madhya Pradesh has been found. Archana Tiwari, 29, is last known to have taken a train from Indore to Katni. But there was no trace of her since.

title: Nawaz Sharif's Aide Admits India Pounded Pakistani Air Bases During Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan political commentator Najam Sethi has ripped into Islamabad's claim of Indian missiles hitting targets during military confrontation under Operation Sindoor.

title: Why Opposition's Veep Choice Places Key BJP Ally In A Tricky Spot
content: The INDIA opposition bloc's announcement of Justice (retired) B Sudershan Reddy as its candidate for the Vice Presidential election is an attempt to turn the tables after the BJP put INDIA ally DMK in a spot by naming a Tamil candidate

title: The Story Of A Bengal Butcher Who 'Saved' Calcutta
content: Rather than being stoic over the aggressive agenda of the Muslim League to bring Calcutta into Pakistan, a fierce man from a city-based meat-selling Brahmin family rose to the occasion.

title: Opinion: Opinion | RSS Peace Offering, Tamil Nadu's 'Vajpayee': 2 Signals From BJP's Veep Pick
content: When the BJP was born out of the Jan Sangh in 1980, Radhakrishnan was appointed an aide to Vajpayee. He must have imbibed some lessons from the former PM - in fact, political circles in Tamil Nadu would refer to him as the Vajpayee of the state BJP.

title: ISRO Working On 40-Storey-Tall Rocket To Launch 75,000 Kg Satellite
content: ISRO Chairman V Narayanan on Tuesday said the space agency has been working on a rocket as high as a 40-storey building to place 75,000 kg satellite in low earth orbit.

title: Iran Publically Executes Man For Murdering Family Of 4
content: Murder and rape are punishable by death in Iran, which is second only to China in terms of the number of executions it carries out, according to rights groups including Amnesty International.

title: On Camera, 6 Tesla Cars Burn As Vehicle-Carrier Catches Fire In US
content: A car-carrier truck carrying eight Tesla vehicles caught fire in Los Angeles on Saturday. The incident took place on the southbound lanes of the Golden State (5) Freeway in Sylmar.

title: Gaza Aid Ship With 1,200 Tons Of Food Nears Israeli Port After Leaving Cyprus
content: Post setting off from Cyprus, a ship loaded with 1,200 tons of food aid for the Gaza Strip was approaching the Israeli port of Ashdod on Tuesday in a renewed effort to alleviate the worsening crisis, as famine threatens the Palestinian territory.

title: POCSO Act Is Gender Neutral, Intends To Safeguard Childhood: Karnataka High Court
content: The Karnataka High Court on Monday dismissed a petition filed by a 52-year-old woman seeking to quash a sexual assault case under POCSO Act, holding that the legislation is gender neutral and applies equally to men and women.

title: "China, India Should View Each Other As Partners, Not Threats": Wang Yi To S Jaishankar
content: During talks with S Jaishankar, Wang Yi said relations between China and India are on a "positive trend" towards cooperation.

title: Atlantic Hurricane Season Sets Peak Record As Storm Erin Threatens US Coast
content: Hurricane Erin's massive footprint battered Caribbean islands with heavy gusts and downpours on Monday, as it threatened rip currents and flooding along the US East Coast later this week, even without a predicted landfall.
